Charlie Kirk assassination: The suspect's disconcerting profile
description: Tyler Robinson, arrested on Thursday night, is a 22-year-old White man who grew up in a conservative family in Utah and was a brilliant high school student. Nothing in his background supports the theory being propagated in MAGA circles that he is a far-left activist.

headline: Israeli intelligence admits Iran's nuclear program has not been destroyed

Undercover but never unmasked: The untold story of a KGB spy in France
description: Following archival research and interviews with witnesses, Le Monde pieced together the completely unknown story of 'Lydia Tows,' a Russian agent who died in Paris in 1999. Working in tandem with a French police officer, she carried out a decades-long infiltration mission with devastating consequences.

headline: Sushila Karki appointed as Nepal's prime minister with mission to preserve unity
description: Four days after violence left 51 people dead and devastated key seats of power, the former chief justice of the Supreme Court was appointed as interim prime minister. Parliament was dissolved.

headline: Tasting clubs are discreetly shaping France's wine culture
description: Thousands of enthusiasts gather in associations or informal groups, whether at home or in bars, for themed tastings – some highly structured. The values of sharing and passing on knowledge drive these get-togethers.

headline: Dan Brown, author of 'The Secret of Secrets': Robert Langdon is 'the man I wish I could be'
description: The American author discusses his new novel, 'The Secret of Secrets,' and the relationship he has with books' recurring protagonist, Robert Langdon, some of whose esoteric beliefs he now seems to share.

When everyday hatred turns to racist murder: 'I don't know why I lost it. I have no idea'
description: On May 31, Christophe Belgembe, a mechanic, fatally shot his neighbor Hichem Miraoui and tried to kill five other people in the southern French town of Puget-sur-Argens. Though he had made racist remarks for years, he struggled to explain his actions.
byline: Jérôme Lefilliâtre and  Lorraine de Foucher

headline: France's new PM Lecornu faces immediate wall of mistrust
description: The prime minister has started consultations with political parties and labor unions. While an agreement between the centrist bloc and the right is possible, the Socialists are still hesitant to compromise.
byline: Mariama Darame,  Marie Pouzadoux and  Sandrine Cassini

headline: France's 'Block Everything' protests converge around ousting Macron
description: Although France did not come to a standstill or grind to a halt on Wednesday, numerous protests took place throughout the day across the country with large gatherings in certain cities – with headcounts between 197,000 and 250,000 people – amid the firm presence of law enforcement.
